intro: Icacorea crassa, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Icacorea crassa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
